Hi, I'm Bryan.



About Me
I'm a front and back-end web developer. Throughout my CS Journey, I have become familiar with a multitude of programming languages including Ruby on Rails, Java, Python, and Javascript. I am also proficient in HTML, CSS, Git.

Other Stuff about me:
  1. I've been playing piano for a long while now. The weird part about it? I hate classical music.
  2. My interest in technology doesn't just stop at Web Development. There's also... Minecraft.

Projects:
Team Manager:
Description: An open source application designed to contain records and manage information with students on the Stuyvesant Robotics Team. Built with JavaScript, React, and the Twilio SMS API.
Uses: Google OAuth for login purposes, Rails Action Controllers and Views as well as CSS, HTML, Ruby and Javascript from open source libraries.

Tweeter:
Description: A web application built to visualize specific data from tweets all around the world. Built with Javascript, HTML, CSS, Google Maps API and Twitter Developers API.
Takes in a search option and tweets with the same parameters. With the Google Maps API, Google Earth generates markers that provide information for tweets.

About the Website:
There's not much to say other than that it still has a LONG way to go. Currently it is written through the use of Jekyll and Bootstrap. As for hosting, Github Pages has got me covered for now. =)
